issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: The synchronous Scanner is not integrated with ExecPlans and doesn't offer better performance in any case than the asynchronous scanner, so we should start migrating away from the extraneous code path so it can be deprecated and then deleted.

comments.body: Is your goal to make the async scanner the default with the sync as a valid fallback?  Or to make the async scanner the default with sync deprecated?  Also, I don't see any fix version, are you aiming for 5.0?

In the python bindings we have a {{use_async}} keyword which currently defaults to False. As a first step (in 5.0.0?), we could already switch the default, while still leaving {{use_async=False}} as a manual fallback option for some time.

I'd be on board with any of the following:

 1. Leave it how it is for 5.0.0, async is an opt-in feature

 2. Set async to default, leave sync alone, async is an opt-out feature

 3. Set async to default, deprecate sync, async is an opt-out but strongly recommended feature

If I had to vote I'd go for 1 or 2 and probably 2.
I would vote for #2 as well - maybe we don't need to add deprecation warnings yet (for 6.0.0 perhaps) especially if we want to leave it as a fallback for now while we iron out any potential kinks.
Since we have a PR now, do we want to include this in 5.0?

The PR needs some work (dataset writes still require sync scanner so we need to fallback to sync when constructing a scanner for a write) and I'm heads down on ARROW-13386 which I expect will take me the rest of the day.  If this is the only thing preventing an RC then I would say to go ahead and cut the RC without this.

Given that we've already communicated removing this I think a better approach will be to simply remove the synchronous APIs (related: ARROW-13554).  This would depend on ARROW-13542 which will provide an async dataset write (but break the sync dataset write).

Just an update that this is currently blocked.  The async write is coming along fine and should be available for 6.0.0 but it is not clear to me yet that 6.0.0's async scanner will support back pressure.  If the async scanner does not have that feature then I would be reluctant to make it the default.  I will try and resolve this soon.
[~westonpace] what's the state of this one? Is it something that was already addressed elsewhere or is a still valid issue?

This is what I am currently working on.  Switching over to the async scanner everywhere has revealed a (not related to scanning) issue with extension types.  Once that is resolved I think this should be ready to go.  It is still valid and I expect it to land this week or next.
